intro: Ammoseris bellidifolia, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain the seeds. Ammoseris bellidifolia is well adapted to drought conditions and thrives in full sun.
